2104.03820.sentence: For large codebases, the downside of imperfectly-translated code may be less than the upside of simply having automatically-produced translations.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: However, code is unique compared to other kinds of natural languages: code is much more brittle, and swapping even a few characters or tokens can completely change its meaning or effect.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: Recent advances in deep generative models have enabled them to produce content with a proficiency often indistinguishable from that of humans.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: These models have been rapidly adopted in many domains.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: Less attention has been given to scenarios with objective outcomes, such as in software engineering where correct code is of prime importance.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: In addition, code demands a certain level of correctness: code either compiles or does not, and it is either correct or contains bugs such as logic errors, security flaws, or race conditions.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: The possibility that a software problem would be introduced by a compilation process, for example, would not be considered under ordinary circumstances.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: Recent advances in deep generative models have enabled them to produce content of a quality indistinguishable from that produced by a human being.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: Counter to expectations, software engineers felt a generative model that produced imperfect output  such as code with compilation or logical errors  would be a useful aid, albeit one subject to the same procedures of review and testing as code produced by their colleagues.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: While conventional software development tools are generally quite reliable, software engineers themselves are not.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: Software developers typically work with deterministic tools and a great deal of work goes into ensuring that these tools are highly reliable [19].
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: New unsupervised neural machine translation models have demonstrated the capability for generative AI to translate code from one programming language to another in the software engineering domain.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: Recently, generative techniques have been applied to the realm of software engineering.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: Given the probabilistic nature of deep learning models, we posit that there will always be some amount of noise in their output; correspondingly, deep generative models that produce code as output may exhibit some amount of deviation from a programmers intentions.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: Many of these difficulties were due to decisions made by people who were no longer present in the team or in the company.
2104.03820.label: Background

2104.03820.sentence: Given the imperfect output of state-of-the-art NMT models, we posit that such systems will act in concert with human software engineers as a collaborative partner or teammate.
2104.03820.label: Background
